com.FCI.SWE.Services

Class UserServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.FCI.SWE.Services.UserServices

  • @Path(value="/")
@Produces(value="text/plain")
public class UserServices
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains REST services, also contains action function for Android application
    Since:
    2014-02-12
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Noha Magdy, Heba Shamardy, Noha Hegazy, Neama Foaud, Nehal Khaled

      java.lang.String loginService(java.lang.String pass, java.lang.String email)

      java.lang.String showFriendRequests(java.lang.String uemail)
      show friend requests Rest service, this service will be called to show friend requests sent to the current user of the system by providing his email.

    • Method Detail

      • registrationService

        @POST
@Path(value="/RegistrationService")
public java.lang.String registrationService(@FormParam(value="uname")
                                             java.lang.String uname,
                                             @FormParam(value="email")
                                             java.lang.String email,
                                             @FormParam(value="password")
                                             java.lang.String pass)
        Registration Rest service, this service will be called to make registration. This function will store user data in data store
        Parameters:
        uname - provided user name
        email - provided user email
        pass - provided password
        Returns:
        Status json

      • addFriend

        @POST
@Path(value="/AddFriendService")
public java.lang.String addFriend(@FormParam(value="uemail")
                                   java.lang.String uemail,
                                   @FormParam(value="femail")
                                   java.lang.String femail)
        Accept Friend Rest service, this service will be called to accept a friend request that was sent to the active user. This function will store the two friends' email in data store.
        Parameters:
        uemail - provided current user email
        femail - provided the accepted friend email
        Returns:
        Status json

      • denyFriendRequset

        @POST
@Path(value="/denyFriendService")
public java.lang.String denyFriendRequset(@FormParam(value="uemail")
                                           java.lang.String uemail,
                                           @FormParam(value="femail")
                                           java.lang.String femail)
        Deny friend request Rest service, this service will be called to deny a request that was sent to current user. This function will delete the request that is denied from data store
        Parameters:
        uemail - provided current user email
        femail - provided the friend email
        Returns:
        Status json

      • loginService

        @POST
@Path(value="/LoginService")
public java.lang.String loginService(@FormParam(value="password")
                                      java.lang.String pass,
                                      @FormParam(value="email")
                                      java.lang.String email)
        Login Rest Service, this service will be called to make login process also will check user data and returns new user from datastore
        Parameters:
        uname - provided user name
        pass - provided user password
        Returns:
        user in json format

      • sendFriendRequest

        @POST
@Path(value="/sendFriendRequest")
public java.lang.String sendFriendRequest(@FormParam(value="uemail")
                                           java.lang.String uemail,
                                           @FormParam(value="femail")
                                           java.lang.String femail)
        send friend request Rest service, this service will be called to send a request to a user of the system by providing his email. This function will store a friend request by storing two email in data store
        Parameters:
        uemail - provided current user email
        femail - provided the friend email that a request will be sent to
        Returns:
        Status json

      • showFriendRequests

        @POST
@Path(value="/showFriendRequests")
public java.lang.String showFriendRequests(@FormParam(value="uemail")
                                            java.lang.String uemail)
        show friend requests Rest service, this service will be called to show friend requests sent to the current user of the system by providing his email. This function will show the friend requests by searching by his email in data store.
        Parameters:
        uemail - provided current user email
        Returns:
        Status JSONArray
